snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry also warned that the United States was prepared to impose sanctions if the leader, Riek Machar, refuses.
abstract: Heavy clashes in Bentiu, South Sudan, call into question Sec of State John Kerry's peacemaking efforts in the country; rebels loyal to former Vice Pres Riek Machar push back government troops to outskirts of city in a tug-of-war for control.

byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Bentiu, and Michael R. Gordon from Luanda, Angola. Benno Muchler contributed reporting from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry also warned that the United States was prepared to impose sanctions if the leader, Riek Machar, refuses.

headline.main: South Sudan Fighting Rages as Kerry Appeals to Rebel Leader
headline.print_headline: South Sudan Fighting Rages as Kerry Appeals to Rebel Leader
